🚀Getting Started

Quick Tab Switcher helps you navigate between browser tabs efficiently using simple keyboard shortcuts. No more endless tab hunting!

Core Commands

  • Custom Key + Tab - Index a tab
  • Custom Key + Shift - Switch to indexed tab

🎯How It Works

  1. Indexing Your First Tab
    • Navigate to a tab you frequently use
    • Press your chosen Custom Key (e.g., 'J') + Tab
    • The tab is now indexed and will appear in the Quick Tab Switcher panel
  2. Quick Switching

    Once you've indexed a tab, instantly jump to it by pressing your Custom Key + Shift

  3. Managing Indexed Tabs
    • Update an index: Simply use the same Custom Key on a different tab
    • Remove an index: Click the Delete button next to any indexed tab
    • View all indexes: Open the Quick Tab Switcher panel
  4. Customizing Per Window

    Each browser window manages its own key bindings, allowing you to set unique shortcuts in separate windows. This flexibility helps you organize tasks across different browser instances.

💡Pro Tips

Choose Memorable Keys

  • Numbers (1-9) for numbered tabs
  • Letters that match website names (G for Gmail)
  • Function keys (F1-F12) for special tabs

⚠️Limitations

  • Does not work on Chrome's protected URLs (like the New Tab page)
  • Limited to one Custom Key per tab
  • All key bindings will be lost after the browser is closed

Keyboard Shortcut Examples

ActionWindows/LinuxMac
Index Gmail tabG + TabG + Tab
Switch to GmailG + ShiftG + Shift

🔧Troubleshooting

If something isn't working:

  1. Verify Key Combinations
    • Make sure you're pressing the keys simultaneously
    • Check if your Custom Key conflicts with other extensions
  2. Chrome Protected URLs
    • Does not work on Chrome's protected URLs (like the New Tab page)
    • Switch to a regular webpage to use the extension
  3. Reset the Extension
    • Go to chrome://extensions/
    • Find Quick Tab Switcher
    • Click the refresh icon
